snippet: Local Afghan officials say more than 200 police officers and soldiers have been killed during a fierce Taliban offensive in Helmand Province.
abstract: Local Afghan officials say more than 200 police officers and soldiers have been killed during a fierce Taliban offensive in Helmand Province in southern Afghanistan that has lasted all summer and now threatens to overwhelm key district of Musa Qala; district is traditional Taliban stronghold and source of revenue from the lucrative opium poppy trade.

byline.original: By ROD NORDLAND and TAIMOOR SHAH
byline.contributor: Rod Nordland reported from Kabul, and Taimoor Shah from Kandahar, Afghanistan.

lead_paragraph: Local Afghan officials say more than 200 police officers and soldiers have been killed during a fierce Taliban offensive in Helmand Province.

headline.main: Afghans Say Taliban Are Nearing Control of Key District
headline.print_headline: Taliban Close to Seizing Key District, Afghans Say
